ai-mil4.1:7.1_0: On the following day King Migāra’s mother told the Buddha, “I shall put his hair down in the past,” and she raised his joined palms to them, and pronounced the eighth day. Then he should then undertake the eighth day as long as he was asked, he asked for the sake of (perfection): “I will undertake the transformation of the world.”
ai-mil4.1:7.2_0: For he should hold his mind with confidence in him. Then late in one of the hosts of wives, hanging on to the horns, and not squeezing his mind with the prostrations. When it has been decided, he should not trying to make an end of the five kinds of wives, and his mind with loving-kindness towards the transmigration.
ai-mil4.1:7.3_0: After undertaking these eight qualities, the trial period of six days after which the virtues of the Three were established in the firmament and the Trainy season, and having taken evening the cloth, the Elders of the Vaṭṭagāmani, having put down the timber, went out to meet the ceremonies of the Vihāra, and standing outside the monastic boundary, he established the Elder Cittalapabbata Monastery, stood at the feet of the Yakkha, and said,
